Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Dogwood Park Trail”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusTreedoctor
Reviews.Content: Please heed the warnings because this place was an absolute disaster. A week of dirty sheets & the place looks to have had NO Maintenance for years and is dilapidated. My daughter came home and had to go to the doctor because she had bumps all over her and it turns out to be scabies. I had never heard of them and the doctor said they're usually obtained by sharing something with someone. The only thing that my daughter had shared with anyone is the lifevest that was provided by Indian Point Lodge for their paddle boats. It was filthy but at the time, she saw no bugs. Maid service is non-existant, office staff indifferent and could care less, broken doors, furniture black with dirt, refrigerator looked to have NEVER been cleaned and I could go on and on. The only thing positive about this place was the view of Table Rock Lake but we were never so happy to leave a place!!!! So if you want to sit on filthy sofas & loveseats, sleep on dirty sheets, put up with the bedbugs or the scabie bugs....more power to you...go for it and good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly awful”
Reviews.Author: Krrkgr
Reviews.Content: Most horrible experience we ever had. After the first night we had to change rooms. Door would not open broken bed cook top not working fully 1 fork 2 spoons. Even the room we switched to was better but still not the best. Everytime you overheard other guests talking something was wrong with thier units also. Too over priced for what you get. NEEDS UPDATED AND MORE CARE TAKEN. Came home to my child diagnosed with pneumonia from the place. Took our neice also and both kids ended up with head lice. NEVER AGAIN.!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Filth WITH Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: I am 65 and have spent many nights in hotels, motels, condos in my lifetime but I have never seen such a filthy place as this one. They only accept your monies IN FULL before your planned arrival and there is a good reason for that. There is no recourse if you want to leave after you have seen the place. I had to put the extra clean sheets on the couch and love seat because they were so dark from not being cleaned. There was no maid service AT ALL for a four day stay....had to sleep in the same bedding for four days. The worst thing was the bugs in the bed. I am not an expert on bed bugs but I believe that is what they were because I had several bites on my legs after four nights. Small maintenance items such as many light bulbs missing in the light fixtures. And the major maintenance problem was the parking lot which was just gravel and being on a hill, had ruts in it that a car like a Mini Cooper could get lost in. How hard is it to use a tractor and smooth out the gravel? This place is so badly neglected that they must save tens of thousands of dollars each year because of the lack of maintenance. I have read the other negative comments here and most of the problems are ones that we too experienced. I did not consult Trip Advisor before booking at this place and that sure was a mistake. Please listen to the majority of comments here and book your stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: XtremeDisappointment
Reviews.Content: Very old upkeep. Smelly, had bugs. Door wouldn't open from inside. Hot water was not working. Tvs are from 1970s. Good point about this place is it close to the lake and has marina facilities. Plus it is off the main area so there is not much rush. We were glad that we would get to this dark and dingy place at midnight only to crash in the beds right away.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: l l
Reviews.Content: Booked a two noght stay in August and had to prepay. Now we know why. Our cabin was dirty and the bathtub would not drain. The shower curtain had mold on it. I would not let my wife shower because of the filth. Left at 7:30 am after one nights stay. I can't get management or accounting to return my call after speaking with guest services four times. Mary in guest services must be used to dealing with unhappy guest as she takes if all in stride stating there is nothing she can do. This business should be held accountable for their false advertising. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to deal with.”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn H
Reviews.Content: Had made a reservation for 2 days in October of 2012, made these reservations in July. A friend told me about the bad reviews she had seen on tripadvisor and we decided we didn't want to stay there. So today, Aug. 16th, I called to cancel my reservations and they said they were going to charge me 10% for cancelling. I said that was not right, she said I had been told that and that is because of what credit cards charge them. I told her they have already been using my money long before needed to be and that I wanted it all back. She said, I just work here I can't do anything about that. I told her I understand that but she is the only ear I have. We'll see if they return the entire amount or not.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute rental”
Reviews.Author: twfwinedude
Reviews.Content: Our family had rented a trailer pad at this resort, and three days before our stay we decided that there were too many people staying in the rv. So we called and were told that there was one unit left to rent, a two-bedroom, two-bath condo. We took it. We were told that we had to pay up front since it was so close to the weekend, so we did, paying $411 total for two days. After renting it, I looked it up on tripadvisor and read all of the bad reviews. I braced myself for the worst. It turned out to be a downstairs unit with concrete block walls and a sliding patio door for an entrance. It was definitely dated. The couch had a hole in the arm material; the carpet was green indoor-outdoor. On the plus side, the appliances worked, the air conditioning was very good (there was a constant drip outside the entrance from the air conditioner for the unit above us), and the bathrooms were clean. The staff was more helpful than some reviewers had said. Soon after we arrived the handle on the inside of the door broke off (the door was difficult to close, and after closing would open up about half an inch unless you locked it.) We called and the handyman came out and put on a new handle. Sometime that night, the smoke alarm started chirping randomly every few minutes. We called twice the next day before someone came out and removed it. (There was still another in the bedroom.) The pool was old, but clean. All in all, it was better than I expected. Other units like the cabins and trailers looked worse. Overall, it was expensive for what we had. I thought that maybe lodging in that area is just expensive, but looking at reviews of other accommodations it seems that there are many better places for about the same money.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: rzrbaks1
Reviews.Content: Nothing is as advertised. Air conditioning and refrigerator only works part of the time. The "New" condo are very dated and overpriced. Book with them at your own risk, once they have your money you are own your own.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THESE COTTAGES!”
Reviews.Author: kbreneman
Reviews.Content: Terrible. That sums up this place. From ants in the kitchen to roaches in the bedroom, this place has plenty of wildlife. Not to mention all the other dead bugs around. KITCHEN-The kitchen was not very clean to begin with. It had a really bad odor and had a layer of dust over it. If you want toast, get ready to hold your breath. The toaster smelled HORRID. The fridge would freeze things really fast, even if they weren't in the freezer. Sinkholes? Don't worry, they come with the cottage. There was a spot with absolutely no floorboards! We put a chair over it so nobody hurt themselves. There were also missing floorboards in the hallway and in the front room. THIS WAS THE WORST PART OF OUR STAY. BEDROOMS-Beds were mediocre at best. Very, very outdated, and not clean. I was afraid to sleep on them without putting down a sheet first. When you want to sleep, the AC units in the window don't let you. They get loud, and too cold! One of them was broken, so we had to fix an opening in the window. POOL-If you enjoy swimming in hose water, this place is for you! They use a hose to fill the pool. Apparently its alright just to put chlorine tablets in and call it "sanitary." They pool lining was falling off as well. Be careful in the pool. DOORS-The sliding door had a broken track, so it was a royal pain to close. The front door didn't latch very well at all, but neither did the closet door because the hinges were broke. It did rain one night while we stayed. I was very surprised the roof did not leak! STAFF/FURNISHINGS-Not real sure what they were doing, but a staff member had an extension cord running through an open using one of OUR outlets! After that was taken care of, we made the mistake of getting burnt out lightbulbs replaced. We had a total of 6 bulbs that needed replaced, but I'm sure that's normal. Location-This was about the only good thing about the place. It wasn't far from Silver Dollar City (which I fully recommend), and was a nice little drive from the lake. I will conclude my rant there. Yes, this is an actual review from someone that stayed there. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty....Filthy.....Disgusting.....Should Be SHUT DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: Fullerton4
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Indian Point because our normal condos were hit by the tornado. When I called to inquire about the resort I asked 2 questions.....Is it updated? Is it clean? They said "no" to the updated which was fine, but they said "YES" to the cleanliness. I should have read the reviews before I went.....My family stayed in one of the older 2 bedroom kitchenettes and our friends stayed in a 1 room kitchenette. When we walked in the smell was horrible, there were cobwebs everywhere, the vents had so much dust on them you could choke, one of the beds was propped up by a brick, the mattresses were stained and torn/shredded at the bottom, the carpet was filthy, the bathroom floor in the 1 room kitchenette had not been cleaned, the blankets/comforters were torn, the table leg was broken, the air conditioner was loud & old and dripped onto the "balcony with a view". I could go on & on. The first time we went up to complain the office staff just stared at us like they couldn't believe what we were saying. By day 4 of our stay 2 of our girls had ringworm!!! We have been going on boating vacations for 11 years and never had anything like that happen! I believe their towels are so old and not sanitzed properly causing the ringworm. Now I was furious and again went up to the office I told them I expected them to make this right and showed them the pictures I had taken of the filth. They spoke to the "owner" and they offered us a 10% refund, not nearly enough but I was tired of wasting my vacation time arguing with them. I will be writing the BBB and sending them pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: “worst accommodations ever”
Reviews.Author: Dee S
Reviews.Content: I did not do my research on this place before booking as it was a last-minute trip & that mistake just about ruined our entire vacation. I booked a 2 bedroom cabin at Trails End, which was supposed to sleep up to 10 people & boasted a view of the lake & a wonderfully serene setting in the woods. "Enjoy your morning coffee on your private balcony as you watch wildlife..." whatever. First of all, our cabin was right in front of the 2 dumpsters that I guess were used by everyone staying in the cabins. Those dumpsters smelled like dead animals & we literally had to hold our breath to get to the cabin from the car & vice versa. There was NO way that we were going to enjoy anything on our "private balcony", which actually was a dirty wood porch with an old picnic table that had a hundred names carved into it, including Lick. Even if it didn't smell of death, the noise from the window air conditioner would have prevented any enjoyment from hanging out on the porch. And I really wouldn't have gone out there to enjoy the scenery anyway because our view consisted of the 2 cabins in front of ours & the 4 cars that they had parked there. The lake was not visible from our cabin & when we walked down there we saw that we weren't even on the lake - the little bit of water where we were was like the edge of a farm pond. The whole air conditioning situation was absurd. The cabin is advertised as being air conditioned, but all we had was the loud little window unit in the living room. The a/c to the bedrooms consisted of fans that they had stuck in the walls to spread the window a/c air back there. Didn't work! It was miserable sleeping at night it was so hot in those rooms. We had the air on as high as it would go, which meant when my kids wanted to watch tv when we got home at night (since we couldn't go outside) they had to crank it to a volume that we had to yell at each other if we wanted to talk. The cabin had bugs, which shouldn't be a big deal since it is a cabin & all. And I would have been OK if it had been spiders or beetles or centipedes, even a scorpion, but this place had roaches & I draw the line at roaches. I had thought that we would eat breakfast in the cabin before we left for each days' activities & had bought everything for that, but after we saw roaches there was no way that I was going to let us use their dishes. The cabin didn't have a dishwasher & by that time I felt so dirty that I was not going to be satisfied just washing the dishes by hand before we used them. As mentioned in another review, there was no access to internet. That happened to be important for us because my college-aged daughter is taking an on-line class this summer & has to use the internet several times a week. I e-mail Indian Point & asked them about it & a Mary responded that they had a USB device that we could check out & that it was $5 per night. I was satisfied with this but when we checked in & I asked about it I was told that all of the devices had already been checked out & that there was a lengthy waiting list. Well, it would have been nice if Mary had mentioned that in the first place & I could have tried to get on said list. They sent us on a wild goose chase all over the place looking for a wifi signal & I guess they got tired of us because when my daughter & I went in for the 3rd time the lady said we would just have to go the the McDonalds in West Branson. "Sit and have a sundae or something." I wanted to ask if she was buying but refrained. So we drove in to West Branson twice just so my daughter could keep up with her class. Our last night there we lost power to the cabin. Luckily, we had packed some flashlights & my husband was able to find the fuse box & flip the breakers. There were 4 of us in a cabin that can supposedly be occupied by as many as 10 people. If they didn't have enough power to support us, how in the world could 10 people stay there?! I was very upset by then & called the office. Of course, they were all gone for the night so I left a message that we were unhappy with the accommodations & the loss of power was just the icing on the cake & left my cell phone number for them. Nobody ever contacted me. We are not a wimpy family. We camp & hunt & fish & hike & we are not opposed to roughing it. That's not the problem here. The problem is that this place was advertised as kind of roughing it with all of the amenities, in a beautiful & relaxing setting. That was the vacation place I was looking for & that is why I booked it & I feel like I have been swindled. We paid almost $800 for our 3 night stay at this dump & all I can say is that I'm happy that we did have some other good times in Branson or this vacation would have been a total disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Craig O
Reviews.Content: This place is not perfect but a nice place to stay. I was a little scared about staying here after reading all the bad reviews. My family of 6 was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly. I'll bet if you treat them nice they are nice in return. We stayed in the newer condos. The condo was very clean. The central air was great!!! It was over 100 degrees outside the whole week we were there, but a cool 68 inside the whole time. Service was great.Towels exchanged everyday,TP and trash bags sent when ever we asked for some. Rented a pontoon boat, it was nice. Docks are very nice. Pools were worn but clean and well maintained. Hot tub not so hot. I did stay in the condos so I can't really say what the other lodging is like. If you are coming for the gameroom or outdoor games you will be disappointed. Most of the things needed to play the games are missing. Most of the place is old and it is, for the most part, in the woods, so insects are to be expected. If you are looking for a fancy new resort, this is not the place. If you are looking for a good location, reasonable price, an can deal with some minor imperfections then I would give it a try. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Vacation From He**”
Reviews.Author: Stacie G
Reviews.Content: My family and I went here over the week of The 4th of July, expecting a "luxury room with all the amenities" as they tout in their advertising. When we were finally able to get into our room (the key didn't work well, as the dead bolt was busted, and the door handle moved around in the door) we walked into a dirty kitchenette with at least an inch thick of dust covering the entire place, and spiders (dead and alive) all over the kitchenette, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. Unidentifiable bugs (ones with over 6 legs had a nest in our fireplace (not milipedes or centipedes.) The fridge was broken, so the $100 worth of groceries we purchased before coming spoiled. We had to run the dishes in the dishwasher on "sanitize" before using because they were full of dirt and dust.The remotes to the T.V.'s didn't work, and our beds were blood-stained, not to mentioned the sheets obviously hadn't been changed!! And this is all just our first night there! My husband talked to the front desk the next morning and kindly asked them to fix the issues (I can be a firecracker if I feel deemed necessary, so we opted he do the communicating), They said they would "try to do the best they could" so when we came back from the lake that afternoon, there was a repairman working on our fridge that obviously didn't have our door shut while he was working - we spent the next hour killing over 40 flies. When the repairman left, it was obvious he never fixed the fridge, but managed to break our dishwasher when he pulled out the fridge to "repair" it. Another guy then came out about an hour later to "repair" the remotes to the T.V's, and said that we just needed new remotes, but he never returned with any, so we were remoteless. That second night when I was reading a book (on the nasty couch that I put "clean sheets" over just so we could sit down, my husband walks into the kitchen and has to stop in his tracks and reaches for the fly swatter to kill a spider on the kitchen floor as big as his fist. That night when we were sleeping, around 1am I awoke to something crawling on my neck. I quickly jumped up brushing my neck frantically, then my husband jumps up, and grabs his phone and uses his flashlight app on it. We didnt see anything on the bed... because he was still on me! I felt him crawling again, and started flailing about (funny to think about now) and beating my neck/chest and finally went to the bathroom to shake my clothes out. My husband comes in with a funny look on his face asking me if I found anything. i told him no, and then he proceeds to tell me that it didn't surprise him becuase there was a pile of bug guts the size of a quarter on the bed with legs all over (one found on my PJs.) My husband was furious now. That night I tried getting a few hours of sleep on the nasty couch while he searched for a new place for us to stay. The next morning he went back to the office and when the front desk people saw him walk in they said, "what's wrong now?" and when he told him what had happened that night, they said, "your neighbors aren't having any problems." Wow. So I guess the wasps out on the deck preventing us for enjoying the lake, all the bugs, dirt, cobwebs/spiderwebs was just a figment of our imagination. We weren't asking for much - just a clean place to stay so we could save a few bucks by cooking in a kitchenette, but instead this place ended up costing us more than just the $1200 for the 6 days we stayed, not refunding us one cent for the 4 nights we didn't even stay there and the spoiled food. We've tried getting a hold of the owner of the place (Greg) and he won't return any of our calls or emails. This place is a joke, and I plan to report them to the BBB after writing this review. Please do yourself a favor and do NOT stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Place Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: FairPartyof5
Reviews.Content: My family (2 families of 8 people) spent the 4th of July week in Indian Point. One group in the condo and one group in a cabin. The location was great and the marina has wonderful boat rentals at fair rates but the lodging is SO in need of help. Both of our rooms were crawling with ants in the bathrooms and kitchens. When we asked for help, someone sprayed the counter tops with ant spray (no help). There are NO laundry facilities anywhere on the property and though they say they will pick up towells every day if they are left outside by 11, ours were only picked up twice during our 5 night stay. They only have worn out window units to serve as A/C which do not cool the entire house. The units are LOUD and freeze one room while the rest of the cabin stayed hot. Our "full kitchen" did not have an oven but with the ants everywhere, cooking was impossible anyway. The staff offer little or no hospitality, most of them are rude. We plan to make annual visits to Table Rock Lake/Branson but will never again stay at Indian Point. It's a shame because it could be a great place if they would care enough to put some TLC into the place.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kelman55
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Indian point resort for the 2 nd time. Stayed in the lodge area which consists of 2 large buildings with 12 units each. Thie lodge is the closest to the water and boat slip which is why we chose it. Cons: very dated inside. The green fake marble shower/tub is very ugly. Capet, cupboards worn. Downhill walk to boat slip with no path which means its uphill back to your room plus 2 sets of stairs if you're on the too floor like we were (no elevator). Pros: quiet rooms with decent sized private balcony including BBQ grill, patio table and chairs. Kitchen includes DW, oven , microwave, full size frig. Units even have their own free washer/ dryer!!! Sleeps 8. Plenty of towels. private boat ramp and marina, boat rental. Can swim at pool or at the end of the boat slip ( ladder and chairs there). Convenient area to park boat trailer close by. No daily maid service...you place your used towels outside in a special bag and they are returned to you later in the day. Can ask for more toilet paper, soap etc however it took 2 days to get more (ask well in advance!). We think of this place as a step above camping...not a real resort by today's standards but still a convenient place to stay, use boat and jet ski, and enjoy being on the lake. Must check out during open office hours 7 am to 9pm. We did not use the pool, game room, or hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Marissa K
Reviews.Content: This place was ok. Yes outdated, but my group's only problem was the incredibly rude and unhelpful staff. I would suggest NOT staying there if you want to be treated with respect while on vacation. They are NO help with vacation tips, area activities, or your stay at their lodging period. And like it said they were RUDE and had a terrible ATTITUDE.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MidwayARPatricia
Reviews.Content: This place was awful, it was not clean and in terrible condition. We came home with fleas, there were spiders in the paddle boats and in the condo which was a 4 bedroom deluxe supposedly their best accommodation. Poison ivy was by the pool which no one cleaned. The air conditioners were not operating properly, the handle came off the microwave, the refrigerator took one day to finally get cool and it is run down and in terrible condition. The bathrooms were dirty and one shower did not drain well and had a terrible smell. The curtains were falling off the rods and the whole place was disgusting. When we complained the staff said don't tell us, we aren't the owners. We were embarrassed to take our children and family there and could not stay. Horrible beyond words.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: 40044TaffyB
Reviews.Content: Cross this place off your list to stay in Branson. Staff in office not guest friendly, only seemed interested in getting your money. Stayed in 1 bedroom Condo. Room dirty carpet filthy, fridge so noisy we could not get to sleep. Reported fridge to maintenance who said all the motors are old and need replacing. Whole place needs demolishing and rebuilt. Dave B

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay, this place should just shut down”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting a high end experience, but we expected at least what was promised in the website...they weren't even able to provide that. The in room BBQ didn't work, nor did either of the bathroom fans. The pool was not heated and only one of the two hot tubs was maintained, the other hot tub was dirty, cold, and the decking was rotting through. The hot water heater did not initially work, but they did fix that after a day of very cold showers. Also the air conditioner kept freezing up because of the non functioning bathroom fans weren't exhausting the humidity from our showers. It was just one thing after another, and they weren't very interested in resolving anything. We won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in "campground" area of resort.”
Reviews.Author: Jen1955
Reviews.Content: We reserved here based on rate. They had an amazing fall price of less then $20 per night including taxes. It's not really a campground, they have about 13 spots for RV with FHU. The spots are on a hill (as are all things in Branson) and gravel so it was very hard to get in pulling a travel trailer while sliding down the gravel hill. Once in, we were fine and enjoyed the deer and wildlife walking through the area. There is a national park campground across the street that was paved and beautiful. Price was similar and we wished we had gone there. The ladies in the office were very nice. No wifi

Reviews.Title: “From website.. my expectations were set WAY too high”
Reviews.Author: dayonthebeach
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I did not stay in the lodge. I stayed in a 2 bedroom condo, (which was within walking distance to the lodge.) I had visited their website and spoke to staff on the phone and was expecting much more than I got. 1) Room was clean, but dated. Green marble tub was ok... but the dark green towels were not. I prefer my public towels to be washed in bleach please :) 2) The "heated pool" that is open all year long is a joke. It is outside and was covered and not very warm. 3) The "5 hot tubs open all year long"... well, I only found 2 of them and they are not kept warm on a consistant basis and the jets are not very powerful at all. 4) When I walked in the game room, I felt as though I stepped back into the 70's, but it wasn't a cool experience. The games were old, the ping pong table only had one paddle, and the machine that was supposed to have ping pong balls to purchase was empty. 5) Don't expect a stocked kitchen. There wasn't even salt and pepper and when I asked for it, I got it, but not without a lecture about how they don't supply any food items. 6) We never got our mid-week housekeeping service that the paperwork said we would get, and we were lucky to get clean towels. (you have to hang them outside in a specific place by 11AM. Half the time we weren't even awake by 11:00.) It was nice to have 3 tvs and both bedrooms had a DVD player. The beds were comfortable enough and there was even a bed that pulled out from the wall in the living room. When all this stuff was new, I bet this resort used to be a fabulous place to stay. Now, it is simply a run-down resort on the lake. During the summer, it would be a great place to stay if you like boating on the lake. (There is also a conservation park with playground/paved walking trails/beach swimming area that is for public use very close by for $4.00 per day). Lower your expectations with this piece of property folks.... it's not what it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: We stayed (my husband and two boys) at the lodge. Actually, we didn't even stay one night it was so bad I took the loss of $200 from my deposit. It is very old and outdated. It smelled horrible! The "floorplan" of the room on their website makes it appear that there is more room than there actually is. When you stepped in the door you are immediately confronted by the first bed right up against the window and AC unit (which isn't completely sealed from the outside) you take a couple more steps and are confronted with the two twin beds that are right on top of each other. The beds were hard as a rock and crackled every time you moved. The TV was hanging on the wall at the head of the second twin bed where not only can you not view the TV very well, but if you get up quickly you are apt to hit your head on the corner and wind up needing stitches. My husband tried to wash his hands in the bathroom sink and let the water run for a while, but it didn't get warm so I was concerned about hot water for showers. There were cobwebs everywhere, the light switch didn't work. We turned the heat on to try and warm up the small room. I was a little concerned about leaving it on while we were out because it was so close to the bed and the air came out so hot I was afraid it might start a fire. However it was so cold we did it anyway. When we came back a couple hours later the room was still chilly and the heating unit was off. Needless to say, it didn't matter at that point since we decided to leave. In the end we ended up forfeiting the deposit because we couldn't stomach the idea of staying even one night. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. For the amount of money we paid it wasn't even close to being considered a 1-star place. Additionally, the staff initially tried to tell us we were forfeiting all our money (including the amount we paid upon arrival) even though their receipt clearly states the policy of keeping the deposit. They eventually did refund us the amount we paid on arrival and we ate the deposit. We ended up finding another place that was what I would consider at least a 4-star which included a full breakfast for free as well as free dessert each night and it was only $54-64 night (before taxes) and the customer service was MUCH MUCH better!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at another resort!”
Reviews.Author: SusanBerg
Reviews.Content: I booked a lodge room with a kitchenette coming in Friday night. The room was terrible! Only 2 of the 4 burners on the stove worked, the heater is so old you were either too hot and sweating or cold, the carpeting was torn and dirty, the beds itchy,the whole place needed to be gutted and cleaned up! Saturday morning I called to tell the office to advise them the stove didn't work. We came back in the afternoon and still not fixed plus the room was unlocked. I went up to the office to tell them i wanted money back for the first night and they offered another room. I went back to tell my family and the housekeeper came to tell me we couldn't go in that room because the stove didn't work. Three rooms later I called the office again and told them to change us to a condo (housekeeper told us those rooms are much nicer). The condo that we received was nice and clean. The housekeeping and maintance person were helpful, the office staff not at all. I have requested a credit for the first night as they did not give us what we had paid for. If you put this on your credit card, call and stop payment. i've done it before and I'm doing it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, rundown, worn-out condition!”
Reviews.Author: klw3287
Reviews.Content: Family booked a 3 bedroom unit over Thanksgiving! The rooms were tiny & filled with 2 full beds in each room leaving no floor space! Very cramped. Dingy green carpet & mauve furniture with holes in the arms showing the stuffing!! Very nasty looking! We had small kids & didn't even want them sitting or crawling anywhere in this unit! No wi-fi, one small tv for entire 3 bedroom unit, no DVD player, no amenities! Don't know how they call this place a resort! It is far from it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Uninhabitable!”
Reviews.Author: Duse50
Reviews.Content: We (three couples) made reservations for a 3 bedroom unit. The reservation was made last January. Upon arrival on 11/9/2011, we found the unit to basically be uninhabitable. The unit had a VERY musty moldy smell. The furnishings were old, dirty and also smelled. The indoor-outdood carpet was stained and dirty an the bottom boards of the exterior siding were rotting and starting fo come off. They don't allow pets but I feel that dog droppings would be an improvement. We returned to the office and informed the lady at the front desk that we hound the unit to be unacceptable and we would not be staying. So far I have made seven calls in an attenpt to get my initial deposit returned: Three calls to "management" have gone unanswered. Three attempts to speak with someone in "accounting" were also unsuccessful - no one answered the phone other than a voice message saying that their mailbox was full. The seventh call was made to "reservations". Here I spoke to a very nice lady named Marsha but unfortunately she is not in a position where she can authorize refunds. I am now trying to receive a credit from my credit card company but due to the timeframe between the initial reservation (01/2011) and the time we arrived on 11/9/2011, it is a bit doubtful that I will get my money back. We were lucky to find room available less than 1/2 mile away at The Villages At Indian Point. These are condos that are very clean and very well taken care of. Unit 1610 was excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Holy cats we were shocked.”
Reviews.Author: jman883
Reviews.Content: My parents and wife stayed here and we rolled into town about 9 PM. We were tired and the lady at the front office seemed nice so we went to the place and man was it bad. The clean towel had a thumb print on it. The sink was cracked the free wi-fi wasn't avalible and there was sticky stuff on all the desks. we have now found out that there is something on the roof. So in short its not the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No credit back on deposit after cancellation”
Reviews.Author: nanosecond10
Reviews.Content: Made reservations on 10/26, cancelled on 10/27 before 11am. Deposit of $130.00 charged to credit card when reservation made, 3 weeks later and several phone calls later, no credit charge back has been made to my credit card. Be very careful about booking here because the customer service on complaints/charge backs is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “NON SMOKERS BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: BandBexploer
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Indian Point on 11/11/11. We made our reservation at the log cabin. We got our keys and went to log cabin number 16. We opened the door and the cigarette, old musty smell was overwhelmingly DISGUSTING, NASTY. The inside was indoor/outdoor carpet, the mattress was covered in plastic, and the one mattress we could see was the VERY OLD blue/white stripe from the 1970. The sink in the bathroom was held up by a board pained white. The "bed" was in the front room with a red coach next to it. Both had cigarette burns on them. Words cannot really describe the disgusting smell, nauseating. We went back to the office and they said they could move us to a "new condo" --- there were two other families requesting different rooms also. . . the office staff did not seem shocked or surprised that so many people were requesting room changes. . . it appears this happens frequently. We moved to the condo. . . which is across the street from the office which is housed in a VERY VERY VERY old mobile home. The condo looks much like the picture, but much older, very worn, smelly - very "used". The same "red coach" furniture was in the condo that was in the log cabin. NO TOILET PAPER, NO PAPER TOWELS, one VERY SMALL BAR OF SOAP. The towels were very worn. The mattress was "better" but still at least 10 years old and still wrapped in plastic. The frig was dirty on the inside - I did not even open the oven or the microwave. AGAIN -- THERE ARE NO NONSMOKING ROOMS at this facility. THE CIGARETTE SMOKE was rolling in through a connecting door into our condo. It was totally overwhelming, gagging. The walls are very thin and we could hear the conversation in the next room - as well as their "bathroom" noises, water running etc. The walls were dirty, especially over by the gas fireplace. The bedding was the old hotel style. The parking area was nasty gravel, that was dusty. There was not enough parking; we had to park down a hill with large concrete slabs that had metal bars sticking out of them, which was obviously a danger to children. The structure was in bad need of staining - bare wood exposed everywhere. The overall appearance looks like they ran out of money during the build job and just quit. No landscaping, concrete slabs with metal bars, junk lying around. Looking out the sliding glass door, the backyard had a 4 foot hole with the telephone box in it - this was open and exposed - very dangerous to children. Again no landscaping, nothing was cozy or homey. It looked like a building project - that was started possibly 10 years ago and never finished. The lady in the office told us we would be very happy in our "new condo". We never saw the "new"!!! The whirlpool was covered in a pink stain - maybe from the water. It was separated from the wall and had a very old shower curtain. The only road going to Indian Point is the same one that goes to Silver Dollar City. Therefore, you have to wait in line (which can be up to 2 hours) in the Silver Dollar City traffic to get to Indian Point. The nearest grocery store is a Wal-Mart about 30 minutes away (in light traffic). Now for the best part - the condo was CHEAPER per night than the log cabin -- woo hoo -- however THEY DO NOT REFUND YOU ANY MONEY IF YOU 'DOWNGRADE'! You have got to be kidding! The room was 125.00 a night - INSANE! We would never recommend this to anyone - it was wretched. Please heed my advice and stay clear of this disaster. IT WAS NASTY --- ALL IN CAPITALS! NASTY NASTY NASTY. DISGUSTING! TERRIBLE doesn't even cover it.

Reviews.Title: “Large, nice condos with awesome boat rental service!”
Reviews.Author: TJ314
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe, 1 bedroom condo very last minute at Indian Pointe in July, 2011 and were very nervous after reading poor reviews. I have to say that although we were not close to the water or the "nicer" pool, our stay was very comfortable. The room was huge for our 5 children to move around, and sleep. The kitchen was stocked with all we needed for every meal and was large enough for 10+ to eat. The outdoor patio had a ceiling fan and large table which we rarely used b/c it was 100 degrees during our stay....the ac worked beautifully. The rooms were very clean - we were very comfortable letting our 10 month old crawl around the floor. The boat rental was awesome....nice, quick service and a brandnew pontoon with a canopy, plenty of lifevests for all. The "resort" was ok, the room was very nice and the boat rental rocked! Do not book the rooms in the "lodges" by the water - very old and unclean conditions for sure...although the pool there was the best of the three available. The cottages also looked very rundown...condos are new and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!! Read before booking”
Reviews.Author: Krismisty1
Reviews.Content: No hot water for 3 days. They claimed this has not happened in 13 years. Dirty bathroom on check in. Don't apologize for any of our inconvenience. Hot tub broken! Called the owner for 2 days and no returned calls! Beds are old and hard. Fans loud and noisey! Don't book here! This place is a nightmare! Not a vacation

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rented a cabin with another couple our kids. There were some cobwebs and dust around, and they could really use some updating in the furniture and floors. Overall, I wasn't too upset with the place for the price that we paid. We had a good view of the lake and the kids really enjoyed the ducks that walked up to our cabin. We even saw about four deer near the cabin. We rented a boat for the day and the boat was in great condition, but we did have to call for someone to come down and check out the boat to us. The only complaint I have, is that my daughter's teddy bear got left behind. (it was one her daddy got for her since he is deployed) I called the very next day and they told me the cabin had been rented out as soon as we left and the housekeeping staff never said anything about it. I called a week later and still no bear.

Reviews.Title: “What a JOKE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Twinmom13
Reviews.Content: I found this place online and the pix looked good. We wanted a place on the lake so we could go fishing!!! The girl who made our reservation led us to believe it was busy and she would try to get us a good room. If there were 5 cars at the place that was a lot.We checked in and the folks there were nice and seemed helpful We went to our condo overlooking the lake- NOT TRUE we overlooked a couple of old boats in a parking lot that needed some paving. On the way to our condo there were spiderwebs on the lights and railings and appeared the cleaning crew was nonexistent!!A sign was on the railing stating they were in progress of renovations The place was shabby to say the least. Torn and shrayed mismatched bleached out color towels. No shampoo or conditioner. Good thing I brought my hair dryer. The bed was sleeping on nails and the spread was a dollar store special .We rented a boat for the next day and were promised an upgraded boat-HAHAHA. The guy was off and the boats were in bad shape or not working. So... we took out a boat that we had reserved.. They had free pedal boats that looked like they needed an overhaul.SCARY!!!! Garbage was piled up near the parking lot to the dock very unappealing!!! If we knew another place in the area to stay we would've left immediately. I wrote the management after we left and to no surprise I did not get an answer. We loved the Branson area so we will go back and stay at another place!!!!! Don't waste your money!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Very Misleading!!"”
Reviews.Author: mybensmomma
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to have "found" this really neat ~ "resort" online for a good price. The pictures are VERY misleading....don't believe everything you see... Once we got there it was AWFUL..the first room they put us in the refrigerator sounded like a jet airplane revving up for a take-off AND it seemed moldy, musty and buggy! We up to the office and they moved us two doors down. This one smelled even worse, the toilet didn't work..no water pressure. The maintenance man came to fix it..but couldn't. By this time my son, who has asthma started to have trouble breathing....we had to get out....the mattress were old ~ had bug casing under the mattress on the box springs. We had talked to the manager 4 times that night- I think he was glad to get rid of us. It would be a REALLY nice area - nice grounds - view...just needs to be bull-dozed and rebuilt. The only good thing was that we did receive our money back....and we were able to get a room at the Radisson on the strip at 11 pm at night. Our trip to Branson ended on a great note....

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: mjoneskc
Reviews.Content: We met up with two other families for our vacation(last week of august 2011) . We all stayed in the same two bedroom condo. Everyone was very disappointed with the accommodations. If we would have gone by ourselves, we would not have stayed one night in this place. Let me start with the good. The Docks: While we were there, a new dock was being built. There are four docks (I think) and they are all in very good shape. The Maintenance workers: When ever we complained about something, the maintenance staff attempted to attend to it quickly. Extras: This is kind of a good and bad. A basket was on the counter with lots of snacks and little boxes of cereal. There were some cinnamon rolls provided, but they expired the day we arrived and were covered with cream cheese frosting that no one trusted to eat. Now the bad. Dirty: From the start, we noticed that the place was dirty. The carpet was dark blue and had stuff all over it. I did not trust the kitchen counter and cleaned it with bleach wipes. The first wipes came up black with grunge. We ended up cleaning most of the kitchen and living room before we settled in. Any and all art on the walls had layers of dust on them. Mold: There was a jacuzzi type tub in the master bedroom. It had red and black mold around all of the jets. The shower curtains were covered in black mold. Grease: The outside grill's grease trap had entirely spilled on the patio. We called maintenance to clean it up. A friendly man came by, poured what appeared to be dish soap and water over it, wiped it up with a couple paper towels and left. Hardly any of the grease was cleaned up. We ended up buying cat litter and pouring it over the spill. HVAC: We noticed that there was a lot of dust bunnies all over the place. After a couple days, my sister in law noticed that there was no furnace filter. All of the vents were covered with lint, dust and nasty stuff. I do not have allergies, but ended each day with a bad headache. I am assuming that the air quality was terrible and caused the headaches. Broken Items: One of the toilet tank covers was broken and had sharp edges, one of the knobs on our armoire came off when pulled, most of the vent levers were gone and there were multiple burned out light bulbs. Cobwebs: Most of the lights, vents and curtains were covered in cobwebs. Dirty Ceiling fans: The blades of the ceiling fans were filthy and we had to clean them before using them. There were other minor issues that, on another vacation, would have caught my attention more. The condo looked like it was probably nice when first built. The wall paper was aligned perfectly, the furniture was sturdy and probably looked nice when first bought. It appears that after first building the condo, the owners said “Good enough” and only fixed major problems that either the customers or the city complained about. I will never go to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great childhood memories are made here…”
Reviews.Author: kim g
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 BR deluxe condo (1BC) at Indian Point Lodge the second week of Aug and I could not be more PLEASED! Sure we didn’t have granite counter tops and Egyptian linens but it was comfortable, clean and more spacious that the newer condos in the area. I choose a condo over a hotel because of the kitchen and theirs was well stocked and roomy. My teenage son and his two friends enjoyed all the amenities such as swimming off the dock and just hanging out and playing games in a safe fun environment. Docks are brand new and the game room, pools and common areas are family friendly and safe giving you that great feeling you cannot get from a big resort. The property did have older units that did look a little run down but not our complex, it was awesome! We have stayed at different resorts for the past 6 years but no more, I will not hesitate in booking w/ Indian Point next year.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and didn't stay.”
Reviews.Author: Janice C
Reviews.Content: Pictures on website are very misleading. The 3 bedroom lodge accommodations were not acceptable. Staff was very unpleasant when we asked for refund. Owner unavailable and "didn't have a cell phone". I would not recommend this facility to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs updating and cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: The view and location were great , but the property was a relic of the 70s/80s and has not been kept up to date. We were disappointed with the lack of attention such as: missing screens, spider webs, 80's decor;bedding and carpet.We booked through AAA and Reserve direct,. They did not provide details, such as no pool towels,facial tissues,shampoo. We would have left , however they have a NO cancellation policy within 21 days.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it! Worst place I have every stayed!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelanywhere7
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay in quite a few run down places on the water, but never as bad as this. We stayed in unit #421, a three bedroom, 2 bathroom unit. It was dark, two of the beds were broken (they used 2x4's to hold them up), and the furniture stunk. The beds that were not broken were lumpy and impossible to sleep in. The bedding was old, spotted, and musty smelling. I pulled the mattress off of the couch and slept on the floor. After a week of little sleep, we arrived home to find they overcharged my credit card. Still fighting with them on that. I would never, ever recommend this place to anyone. There are so many nice places in Branson, but this is not one of them. Also, we had a child in a wheelchair. This was told to them while making the reservation and they assured us there would be no problems, that the property was wheelchair accessible. That is not true. The parking lots are all gravel with no walkways. Trying to get to the pool area or the game area was ridiculous. Definitely not wheelchair friendly.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!!! WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura38979
Reviews.Content: Our stay was VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!!! When we 1st arrived at our room (#506) there was a dirty glass setting on the table, stool was running and the condo smelled even though you could tell the room had already been cleaned due to the towels and soaps in the bathroom. During our stay we found the following wrong with our room: 1. Stool would continually run unless you jiggled the handle 2. After taking a shower you were standing in your dirty water (ankle high) 3. Fan in living room area squeaked and wobbled so bad that it was not usable 4. Beds were not comfortable at all 5. Electric grill was broken (although we called the front desk about this and it was fixed) 6. Each night during our stay we were woken by the sound of scratching and chattering by squirrels in the ceiling (we were on the 2nd floor of the building) 7. Sewer odor would come out of the stool. 8. Swimming pool was dirty, hair and dirt floating in water 9. Hot tub by our condo did not work correctly (never heated up) I would have to say that we rented a pontoon boat on Friday of our stay and that was wonderful. They charge way too much to have to put up with stinky, dirty rooms in need of repair. Don't rent here it will be waist of your money!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BIG MISTAKE! I should have read the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Bransonlover13
Reviews.Content: Looked good on the website for a family vacation. NOT! Air conditioner was falling out of the wall. Dark in the unit,little lighting, old torn bedspreads, had to ask for a coffee pot, grills outside the doors were old and rusted and had the handles broken off. The pool was the onlly thing on the place that looked like it had been taken care of...Soda machines empty as well as the games in the game room not working...Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected....”
Reviews.Author: cpank1
Reviews.Content: After booking this on-line, we were so dissapointed! Not clean, booked for 14 people and we were packed in there like sardines. Power went off while we were there, and my husband had to go and tell the power company how to fix it!!!!! The lady in the office said, "It's because all you people are running all the a/c units! It was JULY!!!!!!! Our A/C unit did not have a cover on it, we had electrical outlets with no covers, dirt, and not enough dishes for 14 people. If you are looking for a comfortable and nice place to enjoy your family, this is NOT it.

Reviews.Title: “SUCKS BIG TIME”
Reviews.Author: Williar11
Reviews.Content: I reserved this with out reading the reviews---expensive mistake! This is the worst place that we have ever stayed! I figured it would be older, but I didn't realize it had the same bed that the put in it in 1950. Our cabin had a full bed and then 2 twins pushed together. They were rock hard and wraped in that thick plastic so it made a loud noise every time you moved. The window unit that was the air condition was super loud. The little kitchenette was ant infested. We couldn't even buy groceries to be able to save some money from eating out every meal because of all the ants. It had spiders. The towels were like sand paper and smelled like they sat in the washer for a couple days in hot weather. And the topper on the cabin was the battery in the smoke alarm hadn't been changed since who knows when, we finally had to remove it so we could try to get some sleep. Their boat ramp was a joke, all gravel and sand. We were down there to try out our brand new boat that now has several scratches on the hull.

Reviews.Title: “READ MY REVIEW, NICE PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Amy22379
Reviews.Content: I booked a "Lakefront 2 bedroom condo" with Indian Point Lodge in June when everything else we usually stay in was booked for 4th of July weekend. I called and spoke with a very helpful lady on the phone (Marilyn). I did have to pay a 50% deposit at the time I made my reservation. Later, I started looking at reviews of the location and was devestated to say the least. I called every resort I could find on Table Rock Lake and could find no others with availability. In a panic, I called the office and spoke to Marsha. I explained my concerns to her having 12 people planning on coming and reading reviews that horrified me. She assured me that she would be working during the time we were scheduled to stay and would help me in any way she could should a problem arise. We traveled the 5 hour drive anticipating the worst scenario. TO MY SURPRISE we arrived at an older but well taken care of property. We found our condo clean, good water pressure, beautiful view of the lake, brand new boat slips and very clean grounds. We cooked every meal for 5 days in the kitchen and found everything we needed. We washed numerous loads of laundry in the washer and dryer that was inside the condo. We had 12 people showering 1-2 times per day. I assure you, we had ZERO complaints. I don't know what the other people who are writing reviews are expecting in a lake property!!! These are not brand new units, BUT they are taken care of. I am VERY particular and I was extremely pleased with our stay. Okay, one complaint...the beds weren't the best, but they weren't the worst either.

Reviews.Title: “"Our A/C didn't work and they didn't care."”
Reviews.Author: rach031
Reviews.Content: The topper was that our air conditioning did not work to the point that we layed awake sweating and listening to it make a crushing noise every time it shut off. Reported it next day and they came and scraped the black stuff off the filter, so it was tolerable the next night. Never received an apology for the inconvenience, but instead when we checked out the woman was very rude. When I told her I would give a bad review, she said "okay". Don't feel we are that picky, but property poorly maintained, except docks are nice. Landscape ties rotting with nails sticking out, game room not air conditioned, weeds by "cottages" not mowed, rubber missing off pool with jagged concrete by steps, bathroom with missing trim with black stuff showing, worried swingset would break when our 6 year old was swinging, hot tub not working but too dirty to get in anyway. I could go on and just in conversation, 4 of the 4 families we talked to had not been before and said they would not go again. Save yourself, don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible!”
Reviews.Author: abcdmartin
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay over the Internet and were excited about what was described. After traveling all day, we arrived at a dump! This place is disgusting and severely outdated! We were not able to get a refund and decided to "eat" the cost and went in town to find somewhere clean to sleep. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone! Believe the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: adisnanny
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting the Hyatt Regency, you will be disappointed, but if you are looking for clean and comfortable, you will be pleased. We were in unit 420 which appears to have been built about 20 years ago. These are not brand new, so don't expect them to be. We had a wonderful view of the lake from our big picture window in the Living Room. It was very roomy for 6 adults and 4 children. We were pleased with our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: butterfly14368
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews..the place was horrible! It was so out dated and it looked like noone had cleaned in months. Infact they expect you do most of the cleaning for them. There were cobwebs in the shower the carpet was nasty. The whole place smelled musty and the couch was old and broke down.They didnt bring clean towels to our room after requiring you to put the dirty towels in a bag and leave outside. I came back to room to find the same dirty towels in the rain. If you do stay there take your own towels for sure you wouldnt want to dry your dog off with the ones they give you! The water pressure was horrible too..and after all that they require you to take your own trash out before leaving! I was seriously disappointed in the cottages and I am sure I could go on and on about all the things that were wrong with this place..but needless to say we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't walk - RUN - away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingjan
Reviews.Content: This place was FILTHY! Trash cans overflowing all over the grounds. We let them know when we arrived that the trash was overflowing on the docks and they still had not been emptied 4 days later! It is run down and unkempt. Stay far, far away!

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: neuro44881
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo at Indian Point for 7 days to boat and ski with our teens. The condo was fine, but we had problems with the deck boat 2 different days. We felt like we deserved a credit for those days since we were not able to ski (they gave us the wrong ski rope one day and the boat broke down one day). We contacted both the office manager and the owner multiple times, but the office manager was not able to authorize any sort of credit and the owner never returned our calls. We will not rent at Indian Point again because we do not feel the owner is responsive to the needs of his guests.

Reviews.Title: “Resort ? Tourist Trap is more accurate!”
Reviews.Author: jd33920
Reviews.Content: We booked online at their site and were VERY disappointed with this place. * the cabin was dirty and in bad shape * the beds were old and uncomfortable * our sleeper sofa was broken * the air conditioner was inadequate for the cabin * noisy fans attempted to circulate the AC into the bedrooms * the bedrooms were so small it was impossible to walk around the bed * the AC rattled the walls when the compressor kicked on or off * the upper pool was in poor shape- numerous large cracks in deck and broken tiles * the upper pool slide had a huge crack in it * the lower pool was so cloudy you could not see a person in 4 foot of water * the hot tub was in terrible shape and dangerous to enter All in all this place was the epitome of a tourist trap, it trapped me don't let it trap you

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the lake, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: swgdezign
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised because of all the negative reviews. However, we experienced a friendly, helpful staff during checkin (we arrived 2 hrs before checkin). Or room was lakefront with a beautiful view of the lake/marina. Plenty of activities kept our four boyz busy including volleyball, ping pong, fishing, paddleboats, swimming pools, snorkeling, water skiing, hotdog rafting and more!!! Our rooms were very clean including the bathrod, sheets, etc. Full stocked kitchen too! Although we ate out for most meals because of th close proximity to branson and the landing. I can't say enough about the wonderful service we received at their marina.. We rented the deck boats and pontoon boats both were in good comdition and came with rafts,skis and coolers filled with ice! The boyz caught a big catfish & small bass right off the docks. The docks were clean too! The boyz also enjoyed jumping off the cliffs too as well as snorkel. The water Is so clear and clean.. We all did a lot of swimming and just had a great family vacation. I would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “This place is disgusting and dirty.”
Reviews.Author: jamh910
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this place is the location. It is unkempt, trashy and filthy. I have probably never been more disappointed with a resort. Plus it's very expensive for what you get. I don't mind paying a good price but I want the facilities to be worth it and this place is TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here, rip off! Disguisting place.”
Reviews.Author: chadwter
Reviews.Content: We rented the cabins for $228.00/ night once we got there the place was a dump. The manager refused to give me my money back. So we tried to make the best of it by staying there. Upon getting there The door kept locking us in so they offered us another cabin and we couldn't get into it until 7:00pm. The linens were stained and so was the bedding. The towels were worn out. So I warn you stay away from this dump. there are plenty of decent places in branson

Reviews.Title: “DON'T MAKE RESERVATIONS HERE!”
Reviews.Author: monica919
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the worst places I have ever stayed considering the money we spent to stay here. The furniture had holes in it and was very dated. The carpeting was stained, as was the bedding. But the worse were the ants that kept crawling in our beds at night. Also, our toilet was broken for almost the whole stay. We called maintenance the first night we got there. Took them until morning to come out. The man said he needed a bigger plunger and said he would be right back. He never came back. Called the third day and man supposedly fixed it, but nope! Some young man came back the fourth day and finally fixed it. The pool was very dirty. The pool boy dumped chemical in it every morning but didn't bother to test it first or skim the pool, we had to do that ourselves. They never did clean off the pool area so the leaves wouldn't keep coming back in. I wouldn't have let my dog swim in the kiddie pool. The picnic table on the back deck was unusable as the metal was disconnected from the frame. And the BBQ grills were filthy. We were put on a waiting list for the Internet, but never did get the box.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Conditions Ever seen---stay away”
Reviews.Author: coyoteslayer
Reviews.Content: Con Artists, we called owner and he wouldn’t return our calls. Very dirty and stained sheets, we called desk to get new ones and it took over an hour for them to bring some clean linen. The dishes were very dirty and we had to clean what few there were ourselves. Broken drawers fell out of kitchen cabinets. No internet, you had to wait days before getting a internet box for your room. No coffee pot, when they finally brought it, it was dirty. A huge issue was the hot tub that would come on and not shut off during a shower, we had to throw the circuit breaker, and it would smell like a pump was burning, we were actually scared we could be shocked at anytime. The DVD player did not work. We asked for refund after one night in this hell hole, it was enough. They would not even refund money for the next few nights, they basically said we were stuck there. I was willing to pay for the one night we did stay, just didn’t want to continue the stay. They said if they could “sell” our room then they would refund money. They did “sell” our room but then didn’t refund anything and said we would see it on our credit card in 10 days, nothing yet. This place is a hell hole stay away at all costs, go up the road to Treehouse Condos it is nice and the same cost. After reading the reviews we figured out why our daughters and wife got sinus infections, looks like others got them as well from the mildew and must in the 12 plex that is supposed to be there newest condos and you CANNOT see the lake from the lakeview condos. I told receptionist they were con artists and they just huffed at me. BUYERS BEWARE, this place is a dump. I wished i would have gotten pictues of Satans Den, but i was to busy trying to get out of it

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN--NASTY”
Reviews.Author: CiBee
Reviews.Content: I figured the price was decent and close to where I grew up on the lake. I had no idea people could rent out places like the RV we stayed in over the fourth of July. The "pul-out" bed wasn't even a real bed and it was covered in visible stains EVERYwhere. The oven hood was completely rusted out and located where it could cut someone easily. The curtains were once off-white are now grey with filth. All linens were gross, covered with hair and stains. I wouldn't touch the carpet the entire time. When we got there we had no water and had to wait almost a full day to get it turned on. Called about a refund of some sort and was told that because I departed early (I couldn't take it anymore and got a hotel) and didn't rebook that I was not owed a refund. Well LEASON LEARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met”
Reviews.Author: LuluDust
Reviews.Content: After reading through several reviews on Trip Advisor, I must admit that I was panicked about what might be awaiting our family reunion group for the week of July 5. However, we were all pleasantly surprised. Indian Point is in a great location, and while the beds and sofa bed weren't very comfortable, the overall accomodations were decent for a locally-owned, older lakefront complex. Don't come to Indian Point expecting a concierge, butler and down bedding like you'd find in a chain hotel. But do expect the staff to meet your needs while they're on duty. I think we'd all stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: goodgardenbug
Reviews.Content: I will say the room was clean but not worth the price. The mattress in the room was terrible unless you like a very hard mattress. View was not good at all. Parking lot is a nightmare, all gravel, no lines so people parked everywhere. The hot tub at our condo was closed up and locked the 2nd night we were there with no sign as to why. The barbeque grill on our balcony was electric. There was no cord to it. When I called the front desk they told us there was one out from for us all to share! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time over the 4th of July weekend at Indian Point Resort”
Reviews.Author: mxX2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "New deluxe 1 bedroom condo." While I wouldn't consider the condo "new" it was newer, very clean and spacious. We usually stay at the Hilton at the Landing so we were taking a chance, especially after reading all of the negative reviews. We were pleasently surprised. The check in process was quick and the staff was very friendly. There were no surprises at check in, we were able to check in about an hour early. Our condo was extremely clean. The resort is right on the lake with its own marina. We rented a pontoon boat for 2 days and I cannot say enough about the helpful and friendly marina staff. The pontoon boat was a newer boat in very good condition. We also rented a tube which the staff already had hooked up and ready to go for us when we got on the boat. The pool at the resort was clean, all of the property looked clean and the lawns and landscaping were well maintained. I'm not sure I would stay in the cottages, they did look pretty run down. The resort owner put on an awesome firework show that lasted 20 minutes or so and also had an area for guests to shoot off their own fireworks. We could see the Chateau's display from the resort as well. Overall we had a great time and plan to return later in the summer. Also, we ate at the Crazy Cajun Citchen, down the road, on Indian Point Road. It had just opened and the food was great and the owners very friendly. Great cajun food!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Bluetraveler74
Reviews.Content: Very outdated and unclean. Love seat was broken down and one leg was broke. We had small children that crawled on the carpet and their knees and tops of feet were black. Stove had knobs missing, the bathroom leaked water into the laundry room, we had to constantly mop up water on the floor. Upon arrival we were greeted by a dead snake at the entrance. This place has potential if they would put some money into it. The hot tub wasn't working. The nicest thing about this place was the dock area. The people there were nice and we were able to swim off the dock area.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: soonerorlater07
Reviews.Content: Beware...you pay most of your money when you reserve your stay and then pay the remainder right when you check-in. Should have been my first clue! I have never done it that way before and didnt feel comfortable doing so but I didnt have a choice. Called front desk b/c air conditioner was broken, maintenance came out later and turned up the knob. That didnt work...by the time we got back to our room and tried to call the front desk to change rooms the office was shut down for the night. Rooms were not very clean and the towels looked like they've been around for 30 years. Changed rooms the second day then the bottom lock on the door wouldnt lock. Also the pool areas weren't very clean and it looked like they haven't cleaned the hot tub in years. When we checked out we asked to talk to the manager and little did we know we were talking to her. She said she would note our account and let the owner know. Waited 3 days and never heard from him so I called and he was conveniently out of the office. Left a message for him to call me back and he didnt. Called a few more days later and left a message and he never called back. Called a third time and he never called back. Called a last time to talk to someone in accounting and the front desk said I had to leave a message b/c they dont work out of that office. DO NOT, I repeat....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! There are better places to stay and some that will work with you and not be scared to talk to you and fix problems! I have never had such a bad experience at a hotel before!

Reviews.Title: “I wished I had read these reviews before I went”
Reviews.Author: djohns750
Reviews.Content: The check in process was decent. They were not pleased that we have not picked a show to go to, and had to change our package to the Silver Dollar City package. We learned that our cottage (Eagle View Cottage) was right across from the office. We walked in, and were immediately disappointed. It was smaller..oh and not to mention...it didn't even resemble the pictures in the Branson Vacation Guide or their website. I would simply classify it as a dump. The fold out couch bed, which was not mentioned in the booking, was horrible. We folded it out for our child, and I said there was no way he was sleeping on that. He had to sleep on the love seat. Now, the queen size bed, that was a joke. You sat on the bed, and almost hit the floor. The bathroom.....might has well had been a closet. The next morning, there was a scorpion in the cabin. Yes, a scorpion. I would say the only good thing was the closeness of the pool, right outside. You also could not hear outside noises, but that was probably due to the window AC unit. We are definitely crossing this one off our list. Luckily we only stayed 3 nights, and we stayed gone most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: faron10
Reviews.Content: Terrible This was in Cabin at Indian Point It was clean but electrical not up to par. Needed light bulb they came put one in & when we checked the whole socket was hanging out. Fire Hazard. Had 2 bedroom kitchen living room. Air conditioner in living room. Had whole in wall with fans to blow air conditioning to bedrooms. Broken bed in one room. Septic tank (I think) with privacy fence around had poison ivy growing all over. Yard was not mowed. They said we could see lake but could only see small piece thru trees. Could get killed on the gravel on those hills. They also said was 6 miles from Branson. It was about 15. Stayed 1 ni DO NOT RECOMMEND FOR ANY ONE. Fire Hazard & Health Hazard

Reviews.Title: “What A Shame”
Reviews.Author: Visitor028
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at a condo (Indian Resort). The check in process was quick...great. Went to the room and the space was quite enough for all of us. However, the room was very, very dusty and the kitchen was dirty. Built up grease on the microwave above the stove, stuff splashed on the dishwasher, oven and cabinets. The bathtubs were dirty and the toilets weren't cleaned properly. I'd say the dust on the fans went back to a good year or so. Just dirty..gross. Oh....don' t try and call the front desk because nobody answers. They didn't as much return my call after waiting twenty minutes on speaker before deciding to leave a message. The bedspreads were stained and smelled and the pillows were like sleeping on a rubber sponge. It's a shame that whoever runs the place doesn't keep the places up. It won't be long and they'll look just like all the other run down places in Branson. What a waste of money. Don't think the pool is anything special because it's dirty, too.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: mlworkman
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at lake front condo in Indian Point Resort due to location and decent price when split between 2 or more couples/family/etc. When we first arrived- to our surprise- there were A/C units in our bedroom windows surrounded by flimsy boards adhered with duck tape. All condos have central heat/air but ours was not working properly and we were NOT given advance notice of this. NEXT-serious bug, spider, wasp problems in and around condo. You were required to dump your own trash and water tasted nasty. We asked front desk for discount to no avail. Also, the jacuzzi in master bathroom did NOT work, the public jacuzzi looked murky/unclean, and grounds looked unkept/unmaintained. Finally, at least one of boat rentals did not steer properly...would NOT recommend this location to others!

Reviews.Title: “Indian Point Resorts, Branson, Missouri -- Do Not Ever Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Legalbeagle44881
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay on-line and arrived at about 11 pm after driving all day. The office was closed but left us a key to the cabin. Upon entering the cabin, it reeked of stale cigarette smoke, the bathroom was not clean (urine all over toilet) and the air conditioner unit rattled uncontrollably and did not cool properly. We went ahead and tried to sleep in these conditions given the late hour. Upon the office opening in the morning, we immediately reported our experience and requested a full refund of the two night deposit we gave them by credit card. Not only did the resort refuse to refund our money, they stated that we would be charged for the second night as well. When we continued to complain about the cigarette smoke, they advised that all of their rooms and cabins are smoking and that they spray chemicals to try to eliminate the odors in the rooms. Thus, not only do they allow smoking in the rooms, in this day and age, they use chemicals -- double whammy! They do not disclose this in their marketing materials. DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS PLACE. You will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Run don't walk!!”
Reviews.Author: ousoonergirl1
Reviews.Content: I booked this lodge for my parents and nephew. We were staying at a different location but they wanted down by the water so I thought this might be a nice place. Wow!! what a surprise! I was terribly ashamed. When we went to visit them I couldn't believe my eyes. Where do I begin? The place was outdated. Dark paneling, dirty furniture and carpet, broken faucets, no hot water in one of the bathrooms. old appliances and the list goes on and on. What is unfortunate though, is this place has a really nice water view and if they would remodel and update the facilities it has potential to be a nice place. The problem is that once you've been there you won't go back. I was very disappointed and embarrassed. Will NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE

Reviews.Title: “I should have listened.”
Reviews.Author: sedvilletraveler
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews that should have warned me, but, no, I didn't listen. We stayed in the cabins they advertise as "Victorian". What a joke. The entire property is run down and poorly maintained. We stayed two nights as there is no refund. The cabins are tiny, the full size bed nearly filled the entire bedroom. We had a kitchenette complete with coffeemaker, microwave, a full size refrigerator and cabinets filled with pots, pans and table service. It seemed clean, but I always wondered. It's just very old and rustic. The grounds were not mowed and for the price I think we could have done much better. I won't be going back there when there are so many really nice places to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE,DIRTY,DIRTY, NO HOT WATER, Everything Broken, Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cbmartin
Reviews.Content: Had friends and family get together. Rented the 4 bedroom. Walked in and it smelled musty, dirty. Furniture was stained , rug was dirty, bathrooms dirty. AC did not work, had to get plyers out to turn on. NO HOT WATER THE WHOLE TIME THERE. Coffee pot didn't work. Toaster toasted on one side. Fridge trays were hanging down on one side. Kitchen and bathrooms were filthy. One of our friends went and bought cleaning supplies and new bedding. Was a huge disappointment. Will never stay there again. And will tell everyone I know Not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Cbarnes4
Reviews.Content: We live close to Branson and brought family from out of town for a three day stay. The three bedroom unit was not the one shown in the picture. It smelled of cat odor. The air conditioner was not adequate to cool the unit. One wall unit for the entire place. It was so loud that we could not hear the television.
