Had to vacate the bedrooms and sleep in the living room. The first night we were there it was cold outside and the heater would not work. They brought us barn heaters that were in terrible condition. The entire unit was full of caked on dust. Lights in bedroom would not work, (no place to plug them in?) Game room was filthy. All complaints fell on deaf ears. Beautiful area but room accomodations are just awful. Please do not take your family there. I was so disappointed and ashamed that I suggested this resort for my family. I will tell everyone I come in contact with to avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Love Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: db100
Reviews.Content: Once again, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Indian Point. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating. The location is great because you have the feel of being away from the hustle and bustle of town, yet close enough to the city to go any time you want. The view of the lake is quite enjoyable too. Many cups of coffee were consumed sitting on the balcony soaking in the scenery and watching the wild animals, such as squirrels, ducks, geese and raccoons. It was quite relaxing. Would definitely stay here again (and again).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet, with a very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bilzer
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here with four other friends. We were unanamous in that we had a great stay. The suite was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Our coffee pot did not work so I called the office and we had a working coffee pot in ten minutes. The staff was very accomodating, and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Be careful when you return to the lodge at night, the deer are sometimes in the road.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View and very spacious.We were in awe...”
Reviews.Author: insanemommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of the deluxe condos the week of Oct. 18th thru the 22nd. We were very pleased with the size and comfort of the room, more like an apartment. The views were amazing. Away from all the lights and traffic. If you're planning a trip to Silver Dollar City, this place is less than 5 miles from it.The staff at check-in was very nice and helpful of area attractions. We plan on staying again. This time with the kids..They have 3 pools and paddle boats.

Reviews.Title: “Family resort, lots of aminities, helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: sgp55
Reviews.Content: Great place for couples, or family. Very reasonable rates, and the more people the less expensive. Right on Table Rock Lake, with wildlife and beautiful scenery. Only about 10 minutes from downtown Branson where all the shows and attractions are.

Reviews.Title: “It was filthy, I would never stay there again or recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: mawmaw67
Reviews.Content: There was cobwebs and spiders all over the room. There was not enough hot water to finish one shower and the room had a queen size bed. There was no house keeping. You had to take out your own trash. If your towels were not taken outside new ones were not dropped off.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: justmarvy
Reviews.Content: For the most part it's ok. Price we paid for 1 night was outrageous for the room we got. At the prices they are charging they could surely update the bedding, towels and more. Was afraid to walk around the unti barefoot. We stayed here about 10+ years or more ago and they are the same today. Bathroom lighting is horrible. Did not get a good night sleep, matress's are really old too. The docks and location are good and like I said we came in without making a reservation so they really socked it to us. $229 for a 1BR/1BA condo. A $1 for a map, 1st was $10 for boat slip then when we got it went up to $15. You are already there so what are you going to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you like nature”
Reviews.Author: JustWent
Reviews.Content: I read all of the bad reviews before going on this trip and was a little afraid of what I would find when I got there. I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in a log cabin and it was exactly as advertised. While it was hardly spotless, it was certainly clean. While I did see some bugs, you have to remember that you are in the middle of the woods. The view from my porch overlooked the lake. While the playground area was a joke, the pool area was nice, though very small. I would have preferred to have daily maid service and could have rated it much higher if it did. The bottom line is if you go there for a pleasant stay near nature (good and bad) you will probably enjoy your stay. If you go there looking for a five star hotel, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back”
Reviews.Author: sherri30
Reviews.Content: The reason that we picked this site was because they boasted about thier "ammenities" and since we have young children pools and playgrounds interest us more than anything right now. After we reserved our spot I found all of the bad reviews and thought that maybe people were just being too picky because i realize that people sometimes want something for free and think they dont need to pay. I even sent and email to the resort asking if they had done any updating and could they send some pics of the campgrounds. I never got a reply. That should have been my first tip off but I thought why not give it a chance. First let me say that the staff seemed very friendly and that we did not complain to them because we had already paid and decided to make the best of it. The pool was fine though not maintained like it should have been. That said, when we first arrived the spots are not well marked and the one we had in no way shape or form was level. My husband spent at least an hour leveling out the camper with jacks and blocks. One entier side of the camper was off the wheels and just on the jacks! Sure we had our own little deck, but it overlooked some trees with a transformer and a bunch of electrical equipment. We also had a great view of what I believe was the pump station or house for the sewer. On the last 2 days of our stay you could smell it when you came outside. And there was about a 10 foot drop off on our site. We have a 3 year old girl and she couldnt even play unless she was right in front of our camper. The playgrounds were a joke and she didnt even want to play on them. It advertises lake access. Yeah, if you want to swim off the docks. We wound up paying a daily pass fee for the campground right across the street to swim and let our daughter play on the nice playground. The water pressure at the sight was terrible and every faucet sputtered and spit unless it was on full blast. The trailers that were set looked very old and worn down and I was suprised that people were even staying in them. No rules were enforced. There were animals wondering around and some people with barking dogs all day and night. We didnt even attemp to go to the shower house or restrooms. They looked broken down and nasty. So, if you want to go camping and never leave your tent or camper then here you go. But otherwise I dont reccomend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “THEY HAVE A NO REFUND POLICY FOR A REASON....”
Reviews.Author: okdds
Reviews.Content: We reserved a spot for three nights but only stayed one. The sites were overgrown and the view from our window was of a sewage pond. In the 15 minutes i was outside setting up i got 10 mosquitoe bites. I didnt see inside the cottoges but the outsides were rotting apart. Pool tiny and crumbeling. When we went to complain, the couple in front of us were there to complaining. They had a cabin with dirty sheets, ripped cushions and mildew. Overall in a word GROSS!!!!!! Looks nothing like the website.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Upkeep; prepare to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mrb218
Reviews.Content: Good: 1. Decent spot on the lake. 2. Staff fairly friendly. Bad: Condos average (at best). Tended to be worn and not very clean. Most of the rooms offer virtually no view of lake (if you want a view, ask for top floor). Pool areas and pool themselves are run-down and old. The edges of the pool and falling apart, the restrooms located next to the pools are horrible (seriously). One of those places where you don't want to walk, especially in bare feet. Door to that restroom was rotten and black, especially on the bottom half. Just very poor overall upkeep. Be VERY careful renting a boat. They are extremely unforgiving if anything happens and will NOT refund any $$. We rented a pontoon boat for four hours. The prop broke about 30 yards from the dock. They charged us $75, when a new one costs about $10-$15 (cheap plastic). Guy at the dock said they were last year's props and should have been changed but they hadn't "gotten around to it." Manager/owner could have cared less. We will NOT be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: slim60
Reviews.Content: Lake front condo was immaculate,orgasmic view ,staff was friendly and very accomadating.Beds are a little hard but after cruising the strip it doesnt matter.Didnt mind going back to the room because it was wonderful...didnt want to leave. Tub didnt drain too well....so.I would reccomend this condo to anyone.GREAT STAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok at best”
Reviews.Author: Spike1032
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a lakeside condo near Main Resort (3) days, suppose to have been recently remodeled. Quality was really lacking, resort has many good ideas but really lacks maintenence/upkeep. Grounds are not impressive at all; pools, gameroom, hottubs are there but not taken care of. Condo was OK but again not impressive. It is close to Silver Dollar City. I would not recommend nor stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly positive...”
Reviews.Author: Our6
Reviews.Content: I was scared to death to stay here because of all of the negative reviews. But, because of reading these reviews, I knew to ask for a very nice condo - and that is what I got. We wanted to stay here because they have an outdoor heated pool - three of them actually. I wanted to let my kids swim. The resort is older and run down - the "playground" has broken swings and wasn't anything special. I don't even think my 3 year old noticed them. The pool was warm, but was also on the older side and the slide was broken. However, the condo was great. We rented a 2 bedroom in the newest building and it was huge! We had 2 balconies with bbq grills, a supersized master bedroom with a sofa sleeper (great for my 3 year old), and a huge garden jacuzzi tub. The kitchen had everything we needed, including a washer and dryer. We took our 5 children and there was plenty of space to sleep - plus a second bathroom - also with a jacuzzi tub. The area was nice - lots of deer walking around - and is very close to the lake. The kids did some fishing. The cottages they have looked awful - I told my 13 year old daughter that we had rented one of those (just joking) and she about freaked out! My suggestion - be sure to rent a new condo.. It was huge and very clean. The place is a little older, but we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “15 Years at Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: KCTravelers50
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews of Indian Point and it seems that many of the complainers sought the bargain units that cost about $50 a night rather than the new deluxe condo units that run from $100 to $200 per night. My family and I have been staying at Indian Point, mostly around Christmas time, for about 15 years and have stayed in most of the different kinds of units. Real log cabins: Older and can be dated. Older kitchen, real fire places, older bathrooms, but there's a charm in them. Victorian cottages: Again, among the oldest units on the property, with older kitchens, airconditioner wall/window units, electric heaters, etc. Less expensive but with a reason. Still, they have always been clean. New Condos: These are really, really nice. Have hot tubs near each cluster of units, all yearlong. Units are studios, one- and two-bedrooms, with kitchens, decks, gas fireplaces, jettubs. Really nice. They cost more but are new and clean. We stay here every year during Silver Dollar City's "Old-Time Christmas," and can't say enough about the overall magical experience for us and our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure the of the # of nights you will stay.”
Reviews.Author: dbaSulphur
Reviews.Content: My family and I were forced to evacuate due to Hurricane Gustav. We drove 12 hours to get to Indian Point. The condos are nice (though a bit dusty). We learned we could return home a day earlier than we expected. Management would not refund the price of the last day. I understand this is common w/condos but I think that due to the circumstances, an exception could have been made. I also left hanging clothes (only 3) and was told there would be a fee to have them shipped to me. Housekeeping though did not find the clothes in the closet. I'm sure I won't be staying there again. There are some really nice condos down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Worst resort in Branson”
Reviews.Author: DonnyMacMissouri
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. I have stayed in Branson a few times. This is by far the worst resort I have ever stayed in. Rude staff at check in. The room was filthy. Proof was when our baby walked around the room in his diaper and had black feet and a black diaper from the dirt in the carpet. Spider webs in the corners of the room. Leaky faucets. I originally put a 2/3rd deposit for our stay. When I checked in, they demander the other 1/3 before I could even have a key. That should have been the signal that something might not be right. Well, I paid the other 1/3 and will never make that mistake again. I was so disappointed that I sent a letter to the management when we returned home. Guess what... they have not bothered to respond. Do not waste your money at this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Stay - Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: traveler364
Reviews.Content: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. Bugs in bathroom & living room. Apparently hitched a ride home with us... found a roach in our luggage when we got home. DISGUSTED! Air Conditioning is ancient and not efficient left us sticky and hot and was so loud when running you couldn't hear each other speak, also TV is as old as dirt with poor reception, so if you need to watch the weather to check on your day's weather - forget it! Moldy/Musty smell. Allergy sufferers beware. Trash piled to the sky in the dumpsters inviting bugs galore. For less money we could of had a regular hotel room and skipped the kitchenette (which is why we chose this place). OR we could of spent a bit more and had an extremely nice two bedroom unit with kitchenette at a variety of other places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Skip Dodson
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of this property rating it anywhere from 1-4 and was perplexed as why such a wide variation. The answer is the resort has a wide range of accommodations and a huge difference in quality. It has been built over at least a 30 year period, maybe longer. It is very spread out with a very rustic and well worn landscape. We stayed in a new, built in 2006, "Deluxe Studio Condo. [--] The room was clean and had a great view. I requested a good view when I booked the room and I got what I requested. It was a nice size with a king bed, queen sofa, table and four chairs, gas fireplace, TV, and VCR. There is deck with a great view, with a table, two chairs and an electric grill. It is a second floor (top floor) walk up, at the top of the hill. The unit has a large whirlpool tub that my wife enjoyed. We stayed 3 nights. There is a another bedroom adjoining this unit that can be locked off, so it could be a two bedroom unit, but the second bedroom would not have a lake view. It basically doesn't have a view as it looks out onto the access deck for the floor and the parking lot. Linens were not good quality, towels were changed daily but some were frayed and all were average quality. The refrigerator made way too much noise. The room is heated and cooled with a typical, motel type, through the wall air handling unit. As is usually the case with these units, it was noisy. The unit exhausts onto the small deck over looking Table Rock Lake. The view is great, but the experience is diminished by the noise and the hot exhaust air from the air handling unit. The air handling unit sits under the window so it obstructs any lake view from inside the unit. So you get a good lake view when standing up inside but none when you are seated. There are two swimming pools, one a 3-4 minute walk away next to a group of small cottages built probably in the 1960s. Another pool is an 8-10 minute walk down the hill next to the Lodge that is probably about 20 years old. (I don't think we would have liked staying there. They don't appear to be very well maintained although we did't go into any of them) The pools appear to be very, very average, although we didn't use them. There is a large covered boat dock near the lodge, about a 10 minute walk from our condo. There are boat rentals available. There appear to be plans for a "Club House", pool, and recreation area next to building we stayed in and there are more units being built. Unfortunately the weather was not great during our stay,as you can see from the pictures, so we spent most of our time watching great shows. Don't miss Shoji Tabuchi!! [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great Dock!”
Reviews.Author: arronramsey
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a resort with a boat ramp and docking facilities friendly to my 24 foot boat. The last couple of resorts that we had stayed at had narrow ramps and crummy docks. The boat dock and ramp at indian point was FANTASTIC. The ramp was wide and easy to back down. The dock was well lit, clean, and had built-in plastic bumpers so i did not have to deploy fenders when docking. The swim platform ran the length of the dock, and you could see some of the fireworks from celebration city at night. You also had a great view of the Chateau and the Dam. The room was O.K. It was clean, with the exception on a lamp that needed dusted on top. I think the room had been smoked in as the smoke odor was quite strong, but i can not hold that against the staff as i did not specifically ask for a non-smoking room. The pool, kiddie pool and hot tub were very clean. The grounds were kept up nice. Gravel roads made it a bit dusty. The staff were very friendly. I asked if we could continue to use the dock and ramp past checkout, and they invited us to use the facilities all day. All in all, I was extremely with my stay. We finaly found a resort with a great location by both land and water. We will definitely be coming back for the return trips to branson

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: wichitakansas18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo. It was very nice. The room was relatively clean, and very spacious for a family of 5. The employees were very friendly and accomodating. The only negative is the beds, they were hard as rocks! Most hotel beds are not the most comfortable, but these beds were incredibly hard. Not a good night's sleep if your're looking to relax after a busy day. Other than the beds, the place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sskessler401
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week of July 15, 2007. Cabin was small but nice and very close to the Lake as well as Silver Dollar City (within 4 miles). A/C was window unit and kept the cabin cool, water from the unit kept the doorway very wet and slick, we used pitcher to catch the water, which helped but didnt detract from the stay. Bed was a little small for me, but then again I'm 6' 2". We enjoyed our stay and even took a peddle boat out for a ride, family enjoyed it. Kids chased Fireflies at night and fed the geese and resident ducks. Even had a deer in our parking spot one night when we returned from Branson, girls loved it. Would opt for a more updated cabin next time, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Stay - Easy Drive to SDC”
Reviews.Author: NotDave
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here last August (just noticed I forgot to post a review), in a 2-BR Condo. CLEAN - The unit was reasonably clean, except the electric grill on the deck, which was a grease bomb inside and out. Towels were exchanged by hanging them in a bag on the hook outside the door. There was no daily cleaning - it's a condo - and that was fine, as we don't like someone prowling our room when we aren't there. SERVICE - We had booked online, and check-in was a breeze. Later bought tickets for Dixie Stampede at resort office, and the ladies were very helpful on which roads to take, etc. Checkout was a breeze as well. Very nice folks. THE ROOM - Good size main room, with view thru trees out to the lake out windows or from deck. Nice and functional bathroom with tub/shower. The beds were fine, the couch comfy, and the dining table a real pleasure, as it was big enough for us all to sit down and eat together -- hard to do in a hotel room. Kitchen was well equipped and handy. OUTDOORS - Saw deer, racoons, and lots of squirrels from the deck. The lake is down a short grade -- it's good to have sandles or watershoes for the walk, as there are rocks, stickery plants, etc. The swim dock is basic, but great fun -- just a deck area at the end of the boat dock, with a ladder to climb out (or I'd still be in the lake). We didn't have a boat, so don't know about boat-related amenities -- looked like a nice dock setup, though. Table Rock is still Table Rock -- warm, greenish-clear water, and one of my favorite lakes anywhere. LOCATION - Nice spot. Minutes to Silver Dollar City, with no traffic until you get to the parking lots at SDC and meet the cars coming from Branson. It worked out great to come and go with such ease and so quickly. (kept me a Happy Pappy). With the new roads in and around Branson, you can really get into town and back more easily than I had guessed ... but we were there during the week before school started, and I think the crowds were down quite a bit. I still have flashbacks of nearly running out of gas during a hour-long, half-mile drive-and-sit on 76 a few years back, and this trip was much easier traveling. VALUE - The condo wasn't cheap, but it wasn't bad considering that we'd need two hotel rooms to replace it, and that we were able to easily prepare our own meals several times, and reheat Take-n-Bake pizza we grabbed at the Mart on the way in. BOTTOM LINE - Good setup for a family, especially if you have a boat (or rent one), and I would stay here again with the kids. If it were me and my wife alone, I'd probably go to the Chalet (or actually, I'd probably go to Colorado).

Reviews.Title: “Great condos”
Reviews.Author: crynay
Reviews.Content: Really well equiped condo that had everything you could need, fireplace, electric grill on porch overlooking the lake, club house, games, books, 3 tvs. Also very clean. Would be great for families. It ran only 62$ a night for each couple and we each had our own bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place...Great Lake View”
Reviews.Author: rightisright
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Indian Point 5 times in the last 3 years and every time has been wonderful! The rooms were clean, the view was great. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A real rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Velvet2006
Reviews.Content: The condo we rented had a fireplace. But when it set off the carbon monoxide detector, the maintenance person said we needed to run it only with a window open since it was not vented. This is a health hazard! The room was basically clean but still could have used a good dusting. We paid for 4 nights, but only stayed 3, because after 3 nights on an extremely lumpy and uncomfortable bed, we were exhausted from lack of sleep! We checked out the day prior to when we were supposed to leave, and explained the problem as to why we had to leave early. But . . . we were told with a smile that there were no refunds but they hoped we had a safe journey home. No apologies for the inconveniences we experienced there. And no apologies or refund due to their issues that caused us discomfort. We definitely will never stay at Indian Point Lodge again! Nothing is every perfect when it comes to sleeping away from home, but this was highway robbery in my opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: djgtravels
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff was friendly and helpful. The cabin was clean, comfortable and roomy. We really liked the number of boat docks, swimming pools and hot tubs. Very close to Silver Dollar City-no long traffic lines! The covered porches on the cabins were great for rocking and watching the deer, squirrels, geese, etc.

Reviews.Title: “RV lover's don't go here BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have taken time to read other user's review about this place before I booked here, as other people have stated with accuracy, this RV park is trashy, the grounds are not well maintained and it is very hard to navigate any RV through the sites. I own a motorhome and was jarred around severely just trying to get to my site, the potholes are in need of repair they are quite large and could be damaging to certain type of low riding coaches. We never witnessed such a place in the 8 years we have traveled since our retirement. No perks here, really there is no reason to want to risk driving or dragging your equipment through here just dont do it, if you value your property as we do. Listen there are many accomodating and nice RV sites in the tablerock lake area, and this not one of them sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Was very disapointed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 8 stayed at Indina Point Lake Front Resort, We were told it would have 4 double beds, 1 queen hidea bed. It didn't. The room only had a window air and didn't not cool the 2 bed rooms. We found out after taking cold showers they only have one hot water heated for 4 lodges. The tv was from the 1950's and had a bad picture. The pool they posted on their web site was nothing like the pool we seen. And for $198 dollars a night I did expect my whole family to be able to relax in the living room after a long day, that was not the case the living room area was big enough for maybe 3 people and that was tight. We were so disapointed in the room. I would not recomment Indian Point Resort to anyone. The view of the lake was very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Condo”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTootie
Reviews.Content: We just got home from Indian Point Resort Condos in Branson, Missouri. The unit was very clean and, for a studio, quite roomy. We had a full kitchen (small) and a ceramic and marble bath with a jacuzzi. The view from the balcony (second floor) was part land and part lake. The day we arrived we opened the refrigerator to find a fresh 1/2 gallon of milk and 1/2 gallon of orange juice. A basket on the dining table held various cereals, chips, energy bars, muffins and popcorn! We stayed one week, fishing, shopping and going to Silver Dollar City for Worldfest. The resort is very convenient for fishing....it has it's own ramp, marina and parking spot for the boat trailer. The personnel are friendly and helpful. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Love the log cabins”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Trails End Resort at Indian Point Lodge. We stayed in a very lovely 2 bedroom log cabin. It was really cute. It was a quiet place to stay, everything was very clean and we think the best part of it all is that you didn't have someone coming around every day to clean your room. We wanted a place to stay that would be quiet. We took another couple with us that had never been there before and they really loved it. We are already planning another get away to this same place. The money was well spent. For what you pay there you cannot possibly get anything anywhere else this nice for the same price. We have paid more for motel rooms and not been this satisfied. The cabins are complete equipped for everything you would need includng firewood for the fireplace and a BBQ grill. I would highly reccomend this resort to anyone and have done so.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights in a deluxe condo at Eagle View in October. It was a very pleasant stay. The condo was clean and quiet with a nice view of the lake from the private balcony. The kitchen was well equipped. We definitely will stay there again. Virginia Lemons Azle, Texas

Reviews.Title: “The worst rv park in the branson!! A hell hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I returned from a 4 night stay at the Indian Point resort/trails end RV Park. The name of their RV park Trails end is appropriate, because when you get there and see the terrible condition of the RV park you will think that you have reached the end of the trail. I pull a 30 foot fifth wheel, and I had hoped to stay in branson at a nice clean secluded place in the ozarks next to the water. Where I stayed at instead was a nightmare, and WARN ALL RVer's to stay elsewhere. 1st problem is that their rv sights are no where near level, and making your RV level on this surface was a challenge, second is they do have pull thrus, but it was impossible to pull thru them because of steep banks on all sides, I had to back out and look for another spot as the front desk personel gave me a map and told me I was supposed to be in #7 a pull thru but if you cant fit there then here a few more spots you can try, and boy I struggled but finally got in #12. This goes to show that even the desk clerk even knew it would be a challenge, when she pretty much told me wherever you can park it that is vacant is yours. Now the biggest problem with this place is the road in the RV park are in such need of repair there are so many deep chug holes and ruts that it ripped off a gas propane line under my hot water heater. Second is it just filthy nasty, the only view I had was of a shotgun trailer that was falling apart with no skirting and trash under it, and the view on the other side was of more trash a a septic tack lid. There is no cable TV here but It did not matter because I brought my satellite. Also if you come at night good luck there is no lighting here to speak off, and none of the rv sites are provided any trash cans. I am a active RV'er and I am a Semi truck driver as well, and I can say for certain that I have never had as much trouble parking any of my Big Rigs as I did my trailer in this HELL Hole. RV'ers should pay close attention to my review, if you are like me and appreciate easy access, smooth roads and a somewhat level parking pad in a nice setting then AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST's your investment in you RV is worth much more, than to park it at this landfill, I would recommend Silver Dollar City Campground, or Compton Ridge as suitable places to stay other than Indian Points/ trails end rv park. Don't get caught up in there nice website like I did and and think that this place is nice because their website is misleading and does not show the utter filth and tell the real story behind their DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “clean, relaxing, completely enjoyable !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We come down every year in the fall, along with about 4 to 6 other couples from around Ill and IA. We all have a great time and the cabins are just right , not expensive and clean. Everything is provided and the view is wonderful ! Everything is nearby , the lake, golf. SDC and Branson. We will be Back !!

Reviews.Title: “Indian Resorts are great for family reunions”
Reviews.Author: FilmJunkie
Reviews.Content: My brother has arranged for our extended family to stay at Indian Resorts. We stayed in four different condos each time and the management always did their best to keep our condos as close together as possible. Indian resort is far enough out of town that some privacy could be maintained, but close enough to Branson that everyone could get to the attractions easily. We are hoping to plan another reunion there soon. The accomadations were clean and comfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: Indian Point Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 71 Dogwood Park Trail, Branson, MO 65616
